| --- |
| Hepatocellular |

| Stress |
| Intestinal |
| Ischemia |

Note:

* Hepatocellular refers to the liver cells, and oxidant stress refers to the damage caused by reactive oxygen species (ROS) in the liver cells.
* Intestinal refers to the intestine, and ischemia refers to the reduction of blood flow to the intestine, which can lead to tissue damage.
* Reperfusion refers to the restoration of blood flow to the tissue after a period of ischemia, which can also cause damage.
* Injury refers to the overall damage caused by the ischemia and reperfusion process.
